description:
I was a little skeptical before I try shabu bar, due to the not very good rating on yelp. But it turns out to be a good surprise. 
1. Meat is good, we ordered kobe beef and lamb. Both are in good quality
2. Good variety in the combo, tofu, udon, spinach, napa cabbage, mushroom etc.
3. The most *Important* thing is: The spicy wine soup base is super tasty

The complimentary green tea ice cream at the end is slightly sub-par.
author: Wenjing Y.

description:
Not the greatest shabu place, I definitely wouldn't find myself here unless I was in the area. That being said, I don't think there's too many other options in the area so it's about par for the course.

There are a lot of options to pick from, from regular food to shabu pots, which is nice. Overall, the service was also very poor. We didn't end up getting our rice until we were almost done with our meal.
author: Andrew T.

description: It's just okay. It's definitely not a good Shabu place in SF, but "gets the job done" place in mission bay.
author: Malav B.

description:
After attending the Escape Room @ AT&T, we stopped by to grab some dinner. It wasn't that crowded so we were seated pretty fast. You can't go wrong with Shabu Shabu right? Well..

We all got American Kobe Beef w/ Spicy Miso soup. Everything was meh. Plus, it took forever to get our food out. I felt bad for my friend who got the combo since he had to wait even longer than us. I didn't really like how the meat was all stuck together. The quality of it wasn't great. Compared to other Shabu places, this place is by far at the bottom. Plus there was no more ice cream aka the best part!! 

Overall, I wouldn't recommend eating here. We def should've checked the reviews before coming in. Be sure to check your bill, they already include 18% tip. We'd probably be happier and it'd be cheaper if we went across the street for something else to eat.
author: Breanna N.

description:
I love Shabu Shabu, and this seemed similar to one of my favorites, Shabu House, so I was excited to try it!

The pros: 
- Location. It's close to where I live.
- No wait time! 

Cons:
- Food quality: The food quality is... fine. Some of the vegetables were browning, so I'm assuming they were a little old and precut. All my veggies were wilted. Additionally, the meat quality wasn't anything like Shabu House's - my meat was definitely not tender, and probably a little old.
- Service: They kept forgetting to bring out things that were part of our Shabu Set, like our sauces, our rice, etc. When we'd remind them, it would take a good 5 minutes for anything to come. They seem severely understaffed. 

All in all, I'd only come back if I was in the area, and desperately craving Shabu. And even though I'd probably just suck it up and Uber to Shabu House. Don't expect to find me here!
author: Jessie Y.

description:
Would avoid if possible! (Same type of complaints as other reviewers)

Saw the star rating but was reallllyyy craving shabu in the area. First of all, the service sucks. The one person working literally did not care that we were there. When we ordered, the orders come with rice and ice cream. She didn't bring any. We had to ask for rice and then she gave us the old rice. Gave us half-filled pots of broth, and when we asked for more to make it a normal amount, she acted like we were so weird for asking. Ice cream never even came we just left because we were over it. Cabbage was old (you can tell because your cabbage tastes bitter), rice was old, quality of all the food was meh. No idea how this place stays in business. Bleh.
author: Betty M.

description: This is my go to shabu spot in the area. They have quality beef at a decent price. Service is great and attentive. I love coming here especially to watch sport games since it's spacious and they have TVs, beer, and good food. Their next door restaurant is also delicious with a variety of Chinese dishes!
author: Chelsea H.

description:
Ordered the spicy miso and ginger broths along with the Kobe and lamb. Both were tasty dishes. There were only 2 of us and we opted for the large orders. We could have gone with the standard dinner size and been happy. 

They are lean on staff but do their best. It was pretty empty when we went so we did not feel like service was lacking. I can see how service could be an issue if you are visiting during a game day or other major event. Very happy with our experience and will be back.
author: Michael C.

description:
Dropped by Shabu bar on a quest for some hot soup on a cold night, and I thought Shabu Bar would deliver.

I ordered a Szechuan Style Beef Noodle Soup, while the boyfriend got Chicken Curry Chow Mein. Both flavorful, but the soup wasn't hot (and I like my soup uncomfortably hot). The chow mein wasn't overpowering in curry flavor, but enough to still be enjoyable. Portions are really big for what you get (so bonus points for that!), but there wasn't much interaction between the manager/waitress(?) and us. 

There seems to be plenty of space in the restaurant, with a hot plate at every table between two people. Service was pretty quick and efficient, and an NBA game was on TV while we were there. Restaurant was clean, but it was a bit of a slow night.
author: Mary F.

description:
LULZ DO NOT COME HERE!!!!!

The soup base is sub par. At one point we thought they had only put water in. The meat is average, and the vegetables are not that fresh. On top of that they have VERY limited choices and the rice was SO HARD. 

The service was horrible, waitress was a bit mean and took us a longtime to flag down for things even though nobody was there. 

+ 2 stars for convenient location (right across from
the ballpark) and free green tea ice cream at the end!

Overall, won't be a return customer. This place was NOT GOOD, but enjoyed the green tea ice cream! weee
author: Cathy Y.

description: Never ever ever ever eat here. This is he absolutely worst service I've ever had. This place should be shut down. They literally threw the napkin at us.
author: Tiff W.

description:
I've been to a fair share of shabu places and this definitely ranks in the bottom of my list. I was just not impressed. To start with, the broth was not great. We got half spicy miso and half ginger chicken. The spicy chili powder overwhelmed the broth, and the ginger chicken was just so bland it was like plain water. Next, the sauces were just okay that I didn't bother using it. 
However, I do have to say the meat (we got the ribeye) was decent and probably the best part of the meal. So they did get something right. I liked how it was sliced very thinly. The vegetables they provided were standard. Except I noticed that some parts of my napa cabbage were dirty and they gave me all the stems of the cabbage. Maybe at this point I was being even more particular as I just wasn't happy with my meal. To end it, we weren't offered any ice cream. Since I read reviews prior to my visit, we had to ask them for ice cream after they gave us the check.  
I probably won't be back but hoping they step up on their service and food quality.
author: Wendy L.

description: I went there a few times. I had the curry noodle soup and the other time I had another spicy soup. But service was not that great.
author: Sherman C.

description: The service was so bad. We ordered all u can eat, and it takes them almost one hour to give us a plate. Took forever and the server kept forgetting our order.
author: Shui Kai C.

description:
BE SURE TO CHECK YOUR BILL. My Aunt and I spent $33 but her credit card was rung up for $39. We did the math and it turns out they automatically added a 20% tip to the bill without consulting us. My aunt almost tipped twice. It was disgraceful and likely illegal. But at least we figured it out.

Okay pricing for the food. I'd go back if I'm in that part of town again. But the reviews are right about the service here. It was the worst service I've ever had at a sit-down restaurant. I am fluent in Japanese so I tried speaking it to the server after hearing her speak Japanese in the kitchen, hoping she would understand what I was trying to say ("Can we have some water?" "Can I have a menu?") with no luck. It took asking for water four times in two languages to get any. And when she finally brought our water, I got a lot of dirty looks. I've worked in food service a long time. I know how to be polite to other servers in every language I can order food in. I know I wasn't being rude. Unless asking for water when it's almost 90 out is rude...

I went with an out of town family member who has MANY severe food allergies, knowing Japanese food didn't usually contain her allergens, but we still wanted to ask about one to make sure and avoid a trip to the hospital. The waitress initially refused to seat us because we had the gall to ask "Do the soup bases include soy sauce?" (soy sauce is known for its wheat fillers, which would send my aunt to the hospital if she lived through the ambulance ride) and we finally had to decide to take the risk because the hostess/waitress refused to answer the question. We ended up getting the chicken broth because there was no answer about the spicy miso. The chicken broth was uninspiring.

Pro tip as someone who has worked in food service for a long time, if you open a restaurant in a tourist heavy area, like right by the ballpark, have at least one person on the floor who speaks English and knows words like "gluten" and "allergy." You can't always hope the customer with the allergy speaks your language.
author: Emily A.

description:
To be fair, I don't know much about Shabu.  The only other shabu experienced I've had was a horrible one in Japantown where we were given a hot pot full of unflavored seaweed water and a bottle of soy sauce to pour in our bowl.  So my impression of shabu was you dip meat in plain hot water, dip it in soy sauce, and you eat it.  How boring, uncreative, and unsatisfactory to the taste buds is that?

Planning where to eat in SF last minute on Saturday night is such a Herculean labor to me so we decided to go here since it's a few blocks from where I live.

For $32, you get all you can eat.  For $42, you can get all you can eat and drink.  But the drinks are limited to beers.  We chose two hot pots divided to four different soups.  We were given cheap meats that claimed to be Kobe, ribeye, lamb, and pork.  For a second time shabu experience, it wasn't bad.  I enjoyed the curry broth the best and we were given ponzu sauce and a peanut buttery sauce (maybe miso?) to dip in.  They were generous when we asked for more veggies and noodles.  

Service was a little slow due to one server manning the place and the place was smaller than I expected when I walked in.  Luckily we were seated within ten minutes.

Four stars may be a generous rating for this place as I'm sure there's better shabu places out there, but I'd come back again soon due to proximity and overall pleasant experience.
author: Bailey N.

description: All you can eat is good!  Kobe beef, eye rib, lamb, and Sapporo. I don't know green tea ice cream is free dessert or not.
author: Ben W.

description:
Not a good place for shabu. Service is lacking and borderline rude. The ponzu sauce tastes off. The beef was okay. They really need to step up their service and food quality. 

They spray cleaner on the table without caring whether any of that spray gets on your or your food if you sit at the next table. The entire place smells like floor cleaner. 

Don't recommend and not coming back here.
author: Evelyn C.

description: Not bad hot pot but limited in what you get for $20. Just basic vegetables and carbs. Great service.
author: Y W.

description: Really friendly staff and super clean hotpot place near AT&T Park! I was in a snacking mode and ordered edamame, potstickers, and spring rolls. My friend ordered the prime rib dinner hotpot. Everything was very tasty! The place was not very crowded on a Sunday at 5pm. Would love to come back and try the hotpot for myself!
author: Brian M.

description:
Bumping up to 5 stars since I really think they should have a 4 star rating on Yelp. I'm pretty sure this is my most frequented restaurant in SF since moving up. It's always a great visit with delicious food and fast service. 

One tip I can share is that the rib eye is a much better deal than the kobe. I think it tastes just as good if not better and is cheaper!
author: Sophia H.

description:
Dinner review. 

Soup options - 3/5
Meat options - 3/5
Portion size - 3/5

Need to come back and see how they handle the all you can eat option. 

Overall, great location. Has potential. "A-OK."
author: Mark O.

description: Two stars just for the taste. Not too bad Shabu in taste after all. SoMa is lack of Shabu places I guess that's how they survived after all. The service is horrible, by horrible I mean server rolls her eyes at you constantly when you ask for another dish or beer...they don't give you the rice you ordered included in the combo unless you ask, they didn't serve the icecreme included in the combo either. Owner came and collected everything on the table when we were not ready to leave. Me and my two friends were really disappointed at the service therefore we won't go back.
author: Li L.

description:
Pretty decent shabu place! Was debating whether or not to get the AYCE, but am glad I didn't as the large dinner plate was more than enough meat for me. I probably could have just done with the standard dinner plate. I chose the american rib with ginger broth which was good. I'm glad I didn't choose the spicy- man that is fire!

Good dipping sauces, decent service, would come back if I was in the area and craving shabu.
author: Vivian D.

description:
SCAM - OVER CHARGES - CHECK YOUR CREDIT CARD STATEMENTS 

This is the only shabu place near ATT park.  Walked into this place with one other coworker.   We did the all you can eat option and the food was mediocre and the service was terrible.  When you offer an all you can eat option, you KINDA expect to have to WORK and fill the tables with food.  Our server seemed bother when we asked for refills on items.  What's even worst is that when I got home and checked my credit card statement, I was overcharged.  Clearly the server put more tip on the receipt.  Reached out to the restaurant and reported the issue to the owner.  No response. 

I started reading other negative review about this restaurant and looks like I wasn't the only one who got overcharged.  WATCH OUT!
author: Chanel L.

description:
Standard shabu shabu place that was very filling.  We got lamb, pork, and rib eye.  We each got a platter but probably could have two people share one order.  All the meat was good.  We tried all the broths and as a purist, I liked the ginger chicken broth.  The curry was too much overpowering flavor for me.  

The service was very nice, friendly and efficient.  Cool spot that I'll prob frequent.  I really liked the green tea ice cream for dessert.  

Quick tip:  If you've never had shabu shabu, it's easy.  They don't really give you a tutorial (but I think they would if you ask) so here's a quick lesson-  once the broth is boiling, throw in your desired veggies or noodles.  When you're ready, take a piece of meat and swish it around for a few seconds (that's all it take!).  Then you can dip it in sauce and eat with rice, or cooked veggie goods.
author: Lyn C.

description:
3.5 Stars

Broths are decent (not too salty, not too herbaceous) and like that you can have two different ones
Quality of the meat is solid (good marbling, flavorful, tender) 
Basket of vegetables was well presented and fresh 
Rice was on the drier side and became an unwanted addition 
Space can be tight for large parties unless you make a reservation

Overall Thoughts

I could see myself returning again for dinner
author: Eddie W.

description:
We went there on a game night so it was our expectation we're gonna find this place extremely busy. It was not. But hey, that was before the game (we were obviously not watching it) even started, so maybe their spikes are when people are leaving hungry after the match or before heading to the stadium. Although who would be that hungry after all the hot-dogs and crab sandwiches?...

But back to shabu. This place looks really neat and clean and the selection of meat or the other things you can boil (seafood...) is decent, if somewhat standard. They have like 4 or 5 different broths to choose from as well, so you can customize your experience as much as you like. As there were four of us we settled on the top 3 meat plates from the menu and a seafood plate, for a change.

Meat was quite fresh and tasted really good with the peanut butter sauce. What was nice as well, was that all of the plates arrived one by one, with some time in between, so we had enough space on the table to get rid of one plate before the next one arrived. Good timing on the staff part. Though as mentioned before, it wasn't a very busy time for them overall (there was maybe one other or two other small groups apart from us).

Overall I think it was a standard shabu thing. Nothing too special, but the veggies and meat were fresh and tasted really good.
author: Jakub S.

description:
Do you know how to Shabu your Shabu? Well, that's the big presumption the servers here made when Jamie W. and I tried this new spot in Mission Bay. I guess they took one look at me and concluded I don't need a tutorial, but what about Jamie? His mom didn't make him sing "Shabu-Shabu,Shabu-Shabu" as he poked a pair of chopsticks into a boiling pot of water. I just think shabu shabu is exotic enough to amp up the service with some dialogue with your customers, but they served it like it was dim sum...drop it off and forget it until we're ready to pay the check. We were seated at the high top communal middle table that we were sharing with a loudish Asian family who were here for Sunday supper.

We didn't peruse the one-page menu very long since there are only four meats, two broths and two appetizers to choose from (photo: http://bit.ly/1EagEA3). Like most first-time customers, we both went for the $21.95 Combination Shabu Shabu with a Half & Half Soup Base. That meant sampling slices of American Ribeye, Kurobuta Pork and Lamb (photo: http://bit.ly/1ttATFP) and dipping them in a split pot of Spicy Miso and Ginger Chicken Broth (photo: http://bit.ly/1wSSK9R). That was probably the most reasonable choice for a shabu shabu virgin like Jamie. Before the meat arrived, we decided to share the $4.95 Spring Rolls which we felt weren't even as good as bargain basement Chinese takeout (photo: http://bit.ly/1zX0bkd). Greasy with the kind of hard crunch that comes from leaving it in the deep fryer too long.

As the broth duo started bubbling, the Napa cabbage, tofu, udon noodles, baby spinach and assorted mushrooms arrived for us to test-drive our shabuing skills (photo: http://bit.ly/13tw4CB). We kept letting the spinach leaves and enoki mushrooms slip through our slippery sticks, so we were making quite a kelp bed at the bottom of the pot. The meat finally came on a platter in deli-thin slices, and honestly they were so thin as to become interchangeable in flavor. Meanwhile, servers would buzz by with no evidence of curiosity about our level of satisfaction. We weren't quite done, but our bowls of Green Tea Ice Cream came, so we switched gears (photo: http://bit.ly/1wop6JL). Perhaps they didn't like our duet of "Shabu-Shabu,Shabu-Shabu" which amazingly Streisand didn't include in her Partners album.

FOOD - 3 stars...not a very distinctive take on shabu shabu here, depends on whether you want to try it for the novelty value
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...not too cozy in here and rather hectic
SERVICE - 2 stars...speed seems to be the priority with a modicum of indifference
TOTAL - 3 stars...if you've never had it, proceed with caution...if you have, you may want to go back to Shabu House or Shabuway
author: Ed U.

description: It's a pretty standard hot pot place. It's fun when you go with friends and take your time to make stuff
author: Martha S.

description:
Oh, shabu bar. I might say I want to try mum's house of shabu, but secretly I always want to come back to you.

There can be a lot said against you. Sometimes the waiters seem a little bewildered that my group of friends and I need time to debate whether we want the lunch, dinner, or large portion, or that we have to convince someone not to get all you can eat because not everyone's that hungry. Could I be given more napa cabbage? Certainly. But I keep coming back for that spicy miso broth that I'm sipping straight up Asian-spoon-fulls of at the very end, even though I know it's going to cause me hypertension later on in life. It's that good.

My point is, even though the green tea ice cream at the end was not that green tea-y, I will come back, even if I say I'll try seeing other shabu places.
author: Rosy H.

description: I tried this place when they first opened and food was good and service was lacking. A server actually tripped and dumped the meat platter on me and the floor. I said that's ok and just figured they're still getting into their routine, except she tried to charge me for it explaining the meat was very expensive and I of course refused to pay for the one she dropped. That has never happened to me at any restaurant. I was mildly annoyed with with having food dropped on me but it was her attitude about it afterward that bothered me. I came back again tonight with friends as it is conveniently located and easy to meet up. The food was good once again but the service was  inefficient, surly and we also had some weird responses from the server about really easy questions. There were 5 of us and we were ordering sake. Most of us wanted it hot as it was cold outside but  others wanted it chilled. The server said they only have 2 crockery sake serving carafes so our table could only use one. She acted like we shouldn't think that was a joke since we were the only party seated in the whole restaurant and nobody else was there to order any. Also, what kinda of restaurant who has sake only has 2? The server gave us a hard time with the check as well as we wanted to use a few different cards and she tried to lie and say they could only process 2 per table. We all knew that was BS as most restaurants now have POS systems that make it easy to split up checks and this place is new enough to have a current operating system. We know they just didn't want to pay extra credit card fees. The manager ended up figuring it out when we asked to speak with her. Don't go here. I know most of the good shabu spots are out in the avenues and it takes longer to get there but so worth the trip to avoid this place. They are much better priced too. We definitely won't be back to this one.
author: Jen G.

description:
Fresh, flavorful, delicious hot pot with good service. I recommend the spicy miso broth.

We had a large group - 30 people - and they were great - very fast and organized.
author: Susan B.

description: We didn't order shabu but this place is alright.  Me and my friend ordered the deep fried calamari and the curry beef noodles.  The calamari was not worth the $, it was practically $1 a piece, not worth and not that tasty.  The beef noodles were pretty good though and it was only like $10 for a big bowl that fed both of us.  The noodles were pretty flavorful as well.  I might be back to try their shabu one day.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
Sorry shabu bar....

Came back after a long time (maybe a year or so) of not eating here.  I eat shabu pretty regularly and places like shabu club, shabu house and hot pot garden are on the rotation.  Anyways did AYCE here and it's just not the same.  Service was fine no complaints. Our big complaint was the meat quality.  The texture and quality of the meat - pork, rib eye and wagyu - just does not compare to those said places above.  With that being said I am lowering my stars down.
author: Julie F.

description: I believe it is the only Shabu restaurant on SOMA. Not that tasty but quick service. The staffs are mostly Chinese so their accents are very heard to listen and make order. I dont think their meat is that Kobe authentic and fresh but no compliment around the area.
author: Tran M.

description: If you are use to eating Shabu, don't expect this one to be on par with Shabu House or Shabuway. Quality was poor and many of the vegetable items were not washed very well. They do give you a decent amount of meat, which is pretty much their only plus. Would only go back if I'm desperate for Shabu and can't drive to Shabu House!
author: Melinda Y.

description:
I've been several times now as I live in the area, and it's gradually grown on me. My husband and I usually order a plate of the pork, a plate of the rib-eye and the ginger broth and we're all set for the night! 

Service is typical Chinese restaurant - efficient and detached. Some people think it's rude, but I don't enjoy overly clingy service anyway, and I've never had a problem waving the waitress down if I needed something.  

Overall, probably not the best shabu in the city, but certainly not the worse, and it's definitely one our standby restaurants in the area if we can't decide on what to eat.
author: Tiffany S.

description: The service was the worst I have ever seen! Don't ever go there!!!!!! They only had one waitress and she should NOT be hired by any restaurant! She was rude and had an attitude. I usually give 20% tip but this time only $0.01 which is more than what she deserves. For the food part, it tasted OK but after a few hours it made my stomach sick!! I am pretty sure there was something wrong with their food. So please trust me: don't go there!!!
author: Xi Z.

description: This place has very good broth and a rich flavor. The pork is very good as well. I'd give them a 5 if they just put broccoli on the menu.
author: Joey G.

description:
I am so disappointed in the service. I was expecting so much more, or at the very least basic courtesy. The woman who greeted me was very cold, said no to two table requests despite the restaurant being entirely empty aside from one other guest. I was very nice regardless. When asked what was good she almost laughed at me so I had to revise "what do you recommend... this is my first time dining here". 

I opted for a hot pot and continued on my meal. The food was pretty good but I felt uncomfortable the entire time after her first reaction. Before all courses were served she came up and left the check on the table. I was pretty sure ice cream came with the meal. When I asked if it did, her reaction was strange. I think she intentionally skips that portion to get people out of her restaurant faster. I didn't get a: "oh, sorry I'll get that" or "oh yes, that does come with it and I'll grab it for you." Instead she said: "does green tea work?" which she slides on the far edge of the table en route to someone else a couple minutes later.

I just don't get it. I was as pleasant as possible to make sure I wasn't projecting anything at her. I don't think I've ever left a zero tip at a restaurant before but I couldn't make myself leave $.01 after how she made me feel. I'm not sure even that will make her realize how she's treating customers.
author: Boky S.

description: Amazing shabu shabu in South Beach!! Ingredients are fresh and broth selection is good. They have beers by the pint or pitcher. TVs around the dining room for Warriors or Giants games, etc. Menu selection is plentiful as far as meats and they have an all-you-can-eat and/or drink option, too. We did the spicy miso and ginger chicken broth and both were flavorful. I opted for the add-on egg and boiled it in the broth for 7 min - it came out a perfect soft boiled. Come hungry!!
author: Lisa L.

description:
Tip is included?! What?! I've been here five or six times and never knew. And not like a group of six were talking just two people.

Sketchy as hell. Avoid. But their mapo tofu is good.
author: Alex S.

description: Looking for a place to have some great food with your great company! Come to Shabu Bar, great place to eat and watch The Warriors takes the championship home, or watch some SF Giants, staffs attentive to what you need and friendly too, always a plus in my book.
author: Joseph A.

description:
OK, I admit, I may have been overly harsh when writing my last review. My expectations were just too high! I love shabu shabu and I waited months for shabu bar to open since hearing about the restaurant in planning/preparation phase. 

For the convenience, I think shabu bar is decent. I just don't think it's as amazing as shabu house or shabuway out in the richmond area. If you have time to drive out there, I would but if you're looking for a quick shabu fix, Shabu bar does provide you with an adequate experience. 

That ponzu sauce (the black one) is still way too sweet though!
author: Annie Z.

description:
I think this is one of the better quality shabu places.  I like nabe and I think this place is slightly better but they do not have the zosui. 

The meat slices are giant. 
Had the American style Kobe which was good for the price and the meat combo plate which comes with rib eye, pork, and lamb. 

They have ginger chicken broth which I haven't had at a shabu place before and I thought it was nice and light when u want to add some flavor to your veggies and noodles.

The plates come with ice cream. The green tea ice cream was not that great.

Limited meter parking in that area. 
They also have tvs.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Ew!! This place managed to ruin one of the easiest meals to get right! 

The reason I gave this place three stars is because their ponzu sauce is disgusting. Its not real ponzu sauce! Its sugar soy sauce. I couldn't eat my meal. If you don't like ponzu sauce, you might be able to enjoy this place.
author: Farnaz K.

description: Another shabu shabu place? This one is not the same! They have a few broth to choose from, some cost a little more. We chose the spicy wine and curry. I know... this is not the traditional broth but I always like to try new things. The portion control is very well. Like others shabu places, they have beef, pork and lamb to choose from. Their rib eyes were good, very fresh.
author: Gary C.

description:
DOUBLE CHECK YOUR BANK STATEMENTS ONCE THEY SWIPE YOUR CARD, THEY CHARGED MORE THAN WHAT I SIGNED FOR!!!! Came here for lunch by myself . I had the lunch special Kobe beef . It was alright but it wasn't like shabu house . I also had the popcorn chicken which was very salty . The service here sucked . The girl didn't ask for my rice and didn't ask me if I wanted any ice cream at the end . (It's all included in the specials) 

So towards the end , I asked for my check. My total was 23.93 and I gave them my card . Their machine was down and not working so I agreed to let them write down my card info and charge it when it was back up. I ONLY AGREED TO HAVE $23.93 charged on my card and nothing more. Service was horrible so I was not going to tip. 2 days later I check my credit card statements and it shows I had been charged $4 extra so it came out to $27.93. I was furious. Although it was only $4 , I did NOT approve of this much being charged on my card . I am never going back there again. That is the most shadiest thing a business can do. I called the place back and spoke to the manager and she claims she doesn't know how it happened . Whatever though, at least she agreed to give me the difference back. Overall, I DO NOT recommend this place . You want nice fair business then go some place else .
author: P L.

description: I guess people are loving it because there arent so many choices in the area? I thought the combo meat quality was decent and the broths were ok. Veggies, noodles and sides were standard. I guess for $20 you cant really complain. I noticed that the AYE section was already crossed out and they've not even been open for very long. The bonus at the end is you get ice cream. However they were really pushing that we pay up as we were there at the end of the night.
author: Kim N.

description: Good tasting shabu. The meat and veggies don't seem to be always of the freshest quality but OK. Ambiance is a little lacking - feels like a restaurant that would be in a strip mall so don't bring your first date here. I usually can get in pretty easily without a reservation.
author: Tom W.

description:
A new shabu restaurant in my hood? You mean I don't have to drive all the way out to Sunset/Richmond/Jtown? Say it ain't so! 

I ordered the combination plate with pork, lamb, and kobe beef. I gotta say the lamb was surprisingly the best by far. I thought the pork and beef slices were too big, making them difficult to eat in one bite.  As for the broth, I opted for the half and half between the spicy miso and the chicken ginger.  Both were excellent, although if I had to choose one, I liked the chicken ginger the best (much more ginger flavor than in most broths).  Finally, they give you two sauces (peanut and ponzu).  The ponzu sauce here is sweeter than usual, but I really liked that.  The meal ended with a palate-cleansing scoop of green tea. 

Service was nice and attentive.  The room itself was too hot and not well ventilated, so be prepared to strip down to stay comfortable.  The water was pleasantly flavored with lemon - a nice touch.

They do have TV's here, so you can eat and watch the giants game. 

Pro tip: They have the green onions and garlic in the fridge, so you have to ask for it separately.
author: Janet Z.

description:
Warning - $$ not accurate!

With every shabu place, we always get lots of sake, meat and...more meat! 

The meal portions are pretty small - you get a plate of meat (~10 slices) for about $20-$25. This includes meat and veggies. We ended up ordering meals for each person AND extra meat (single orders of meat - no veggies) and the meal came out to be about $50 / person. Prepare your stomach and your wallets!
author: Jennifer J.

description: Do NOT eat here. My entire family ended up in the hospital after eating here. We have reported them to BBB and expect the place to be shut down soon. Hopefully I can save some other family from making the same mistake we did.
author: Nikki V.

description: I would rate this place a zero if I could. Our 18 months old kid was crying and the waitress came to our table and asked if our child can be quiet. Apparently kids don't cry in her family. The food was horrible. Don't know how this place can stay in business
author: Kimberly L.

description: I went there for lunch and it was packed. The food is good and there's enough of it. We had more than enough ;-).
author: Dario S.

description: I was VERY disappointed with the shrimp Pad Thai. It was way too sweet and it came with just three puny shrimps. I excepted more for $13 dollars. Also, I learned Hot Plate next door is owned by the same people :(
author: Amy L.

description:
Catered food ran out at work in less than 10 minutes. Ugh.  You don't know how happy I was to be reminded that we had a new Shabu spot around the corner. 

Only torture I experienced was waiting for my broth to boil. After 10 mins or so, my spicy bubbles were ready for my rib eye. Although it was a bit on the fatty side, it was more than enough meat to fill me up and satisfy my Shabu craving.

Great portions and quick service. I'll be back!
author: Lily M.

description: This place has the worst Asian food I've ever had in SF. I ordered a Pad Thai and it was disgusting. The sauce was like Ketchup and there were only 3 pieces of shrimp. The other ingredients should have no place in a Pad Thai either. All for $13. Restaurants like these are an embarrassment to the neighborhood. Come on Mission Bay, we can do better!
author: Wayne T.

description: Late post. This was my first time having Shabu. We went for dinner after work. It wasn't busy so we were able to get seated and served right away. Since it was three of us, we order one chicken-ginger miso and one split half chicken-ginger and the other half spicy miso. We ordered the chicken, beef, and lamb with vegetables. This was pretty cool watching the pots get hot so we could add the veggies and the meat. A side of rice was served as well. I would go back again.
author: Baseemah R.

description:
Our group of 10 made reservations on a Friday night. We did all you can eat. I thought their service was good. They were attentive. We only had to wait a little in between next rounds of meat. I enjoyed their rib eye beef, pork, and lamb. We also got an extra bowl of udon. 

I would come back here again.

Remember the meters are still on until 10pm on Friday!
author: Ange G.

description:
The rice in the place its fine, not perfect, but fine. The vegetarian chop main its fine, a little bit salty but you can mix it with the rice so you meal will upgrade drastically.
I loved the tv programing, on one side you have football 49ers match and on the other mexican soup opera.
author: Santiago I.

description:
This is very standard shabu. The location is great for us since we are able to walk from our apartment. There is never a wait and if there's a game on, they have multiple TVs to watch from. 

Apparently, at the start of this year they changed their policy to 1 entree per person. That means, you cannot buy one large shabu for two ppl. Each person must get a meal or at least a meat entree. We were very disappointed. Although the staff were very nice as to provide a free beer, it did not soothe much of the disappointment.
author: Belia P.

description:
Decent spot for Shabu -- definitely best in the neighborhood and probably immediate surrounding neighborhoods. Clean, efficient, and friendly. 

Food is overall okay. I didn't think the quality of the meats lived up to Shabu House or what I had hoped. The sauces also felt a little off -- the ponzu sauce felt just a bit too sweet. That said, the servings of veggies were generous.

Overall I'd come back if I want Shabu and don't want to go too far out of the neighborhood.
author: Victor W.

description: The "American koby" beef was okay at best. The pieces were big and the amount of vegetables was great, however, the quality could be improved upon. We were given one tiny saucer of kimchi for 3 adults and our water was empty for most of the night until we asked for it ourselves. The rice was very sadly prepared (dry and still hard) and the soy sauce tasted weird. The Ponzu sauce was also a little off. It was too sweet for my taste.  The best part was the TVs where we watched the Giants game.
author: Kelli Y.

description: Shabu Bar continues to be one of my favorite restaurants near the area.  They've added a few more options for broth (although spicy miso is classic and great; curry and spicy wine are new and very good too), and are currently running a $32 all-you-can-eat, or $42-all-you-can-eat with beer, special.  Great value.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I had low expectations, but this place really hit the spot on a cold SF night!  We came in on a Sunday night and only 3 or 4 tables were taken. My group of 3 was seated immediately. Only one girl was working the front. She was our hostess, waitress, server, all-in-one go-to-girl and she was very friendly. 

We ordered the kobe beef, the lamb and the pork with spicy miso/ginger chicken broth. The kobe beef and the lamb were large sized (worth it for the slightly higher price). All the meat looked fresh and tasted great!

The broth came out immediately, then the vegetables and the meat. I wish they gave us separate utensils to touch the raw meat, but I guess the broth kills off any bacteria. 

The green tea ice cream at the end was the perfect conclusion to the feast. 

My only other note was that they didn't close the front door even though everyone in the restaurant kept their jackets on. To me, that's a sign that the patrons are cold, so close the door!  Other than that, I can't wait to come back!
author: Meredith M.

description: From the moment we sat down the owner was so rude. I've never felt so unwanted in my life! She didn't want to explain how the menu or the food worked. The food was great,  but I wouldn't recommend anyone coming here. How she is still in business amazes me
author: Rose U.

description: A new shabu (hot pot in disguise) house in Soma on King in an inconspicuous area. Great for groups or solo, Nice to know I can grab a shabu for lunch when I am craving. Two beef options, American Kobe or normal beef, probably best to save $2 and get the cheaper of the two. Comes with enoki mushrooms, Chinese cabbage, carrots, clear yam noodles, udon and tofu. For broth you can have water, miso, spicy, etc. Their sesame dipping sauce is my favorite but definitely try their ponzo sauce too.
author: Brian J.

description: What happened?  I am back to update my review because we just ate there Sunday night and it was terrible!  We had ribeye, kobe, pork, and seafood with ginger chicken, spicy miso, spicy wine, and curry soup bases.  All the meat was "rough" We also got slightly sick.  Never. Coming. Back. Ever.
author: claudia y.

description:
This is one of the few shabu places in the soma area, and I go here on a semi-regular basis when time is short and a trip out to further out places can't be done.

The food is solid, but unfortunately we've encountered some fairly poor service -- not just slow, but almost negligent.  What prompted me to finally write a review was the credit card overcharge.  I do the old-fashioned "save the receipt" thing, and noticed the overcharge, and was quite surprised given that I have never had a problem with this before, and the amount was an amount that looks to have been done just to increase the total bill enough that it would be hard to notice (but unlikely to have been a mistype).

I am generally pretty forgiving on any poor experience, but unfortunately this stacks on top of a poor experience we had a month or so ago, and finally had me throw my hands up on the place.
author: Scott S.

description:
I went here with a party of 7 for a weekday lunch. All around great experience - good food for a good price. The place wasn't packed, which is also great (since it's new). This is definitely going to be added to my list of SOMA lunch spots.

You can definitely get better shabu if you go out of your way, but this gets 5 stars because it's good, convenient, and close to the office.
author: Brian C.

description:
unexpectedly awesome! came here on a monday kinda late with a gf, and there was only one other person in the entire restaurant.  we ordered - spicy miso and ginger chicken combo broth - and lots of veggies and sliced beef. everything was delicious - and the portion sizes are good! lots of beef at least, but we got extra enoki and rice noodles.. fatties...

the service is awesome and the manager/boss lady is so friendly. will be back for sureee to try more things and bringing friends!
author: Christina L.

description: Just found this place by my house and it was perfect. The had a good atmosphere and great food! The service was quick and the ladies were very helpful about ordering! Definitely eating there again!
author: Sara S.

description: Currently on a quest to try all shabu in the Bay Area. Given that this place is only a mile from my house I had to try it--it's nothing special. I got the ginger chicken broth with the ribeye meat. My biggest complaint was that the lettuce was sour and tasted kind of rotten.... ew. The meat was very good. The broth was OK, there wasn't really much flavor. I did not like the peanut sauce. In the end this place satisfied my shabu craving, as I couldn't make the trek to inner Richmond to shabu house.
author: Courtney H.

description:
Like:
- Kobe beef and rib eye (much better than other types of meat)
- Spicy wine broth
- Ginger chicken broth
author: Michelle W.

description: The food and service were not good. At the end my friend found a metal coconut milk can lid inside his pot. They just shrugged it off and said he'd be fine. Will definitely not be coming back.
author: Sarah K.

description:
I had the vegetarian bowl. It came with a lot of vegetables and the spicy soup was good with it. The sauces are good, but limited (only 2 of them!). 
It was a little pricy (~$15), so we ended up sharing. 

The place is small, so you can hear multiple conversations from loud people.

Overall, I would come back again for a good hot pot experience.
author: Nitesh D.

description:
Decent shabu close by. Wish they opened for lunch on weekends. I'd go more often.  I have a shabu obsession and will often drive to Richmond for awesome shabu. This place is pretty good and convenient to me. 

But please open for lunch on weekends!!!!
author: Joina L.

description:
So the saga of being a neighbor is that you will come back to the surrounding businesses, not because they're top notch, but because they're convenient. 

I have to admit, after being here a dozen times, it's gotten better.  Each experience has been unique from the others but here's what I've noticed:

1-Service has been more attentive
2-Sesame sauce was still watered down - maybe add peanuts for thickening?
3-Vegetable portions are fair
4-Meat is still on the thick side, but portion is fair

All in all, they're pretty nice and they're a new business.  I will support them and continue my patronage as changes for the better are apparent.  Hoping to give them another star here soon!
author: Alex T.

description:
Let me just say this: this is the first time that I've had Shabu at a restaurant and NOT finished - and it's not because they gave us too much food. The food was just bad. It tasted worse than hotpot that I could make at home. The beef, veggies, etc were all old and not fresh. They were crudely prepared (we got the stock of the napa cabbage ... almost unedible). I am sure that it's popular because its the only one of these local to SOMA, but don't sacrifice quality. Go to Shabu house, Shabu club, or Shabuway. They are all better by 20x.

Truly disappointed. The worst part is that before deciding to go, we were planning on going to Panera to get a quick bite. My wife and I thought that Panera would have been the better choice.
author: Christopher K.

description:
My first review as a new resident of SF! We decided to visit this place primarily based on proximity to our new apartment on a Sunday night. We were a little surprised at the prices being around $20/pp, but decided to try it out anyways.

Since we were newbies, the staff was extremely patient and nice with us by explaining the menu and what we could do. All of the meat options come with a plate of vegetables, udon, rice, and green tea ice cream at the end. If you are with another person, you could split the pot (half-and-half). Husband and I chose to do half-and-half with Spicy Miso and Ginger Chicken Broth. However, about 10 minutes in, we noticed clearly that the two broths were a bit uneven in terms of quantity. Ok, no biggie.

We then tried cooking the meats. I ordered the Rib-eye and Husband ordered the Pork. The other Shabu/hot pot places we've been always had metal wired spoons where we can easily put in the meat or vegetables and leave it in the broth without having to fish it out later, and it was more hygienic (in terms of not mixing raw meat and the rest of the food.  Here - we were given the normal soup spoons which we also had to use for eating and other things. 

The food was decent, but we were just not super impressed with the experience considering the price of the meal. However, it's pretty convenient to our new place so we might try to stop by again to give it another chance at some point!

PROS: all-in-one meal with dessert, friendly staff
CONS: pricey, would suggest providing metal wire spoons for better and hygienic Shabu experience
MEH: Food was decent
author: Sarah C.

description:
Sorry to say, but this was the worse shabu place that I have ever been to. Came here before the Beyonce concert. 

Spicy miso was super bland. Beef wasn't bad, but the veges they give very little. The worse thing is their ponzu sauce. It is super super sweet. No matter how much green onions, garlic, and hot sauce I put, it was still super sweet. I even asked for salt to season the ponzu......ummm didn't help at all. 

The only thing I liked was the fried calamari. Had good flavors with alot of garlic.
author: Karen H.

description: Shabu bar food 3/10, service 0/10, which is what you probably expect from a restaurant on King and 3rd. The biggest problem is that on any given night, there is only one person waiting on the entire restaurant who is overworked and tired. We came in on a cold night hoping to warm up and enjoy some hot pot. The only waiter was so busy and angry that she ignored us for about 15 minutes and then after she took our order took another 20 minutes to bring us any of the food pieces. After we finally go our veggies and meat we had a cold pot because they never turned it on (Cold Pot). Final nail was when we had multiple times for rice and got it half way through our meal. The only positive was being in a warm room on a cold night.
author: Joe S.

description:
Went here the other night for dinner on a friend's suggestion. I'll be honest, I prefer hot pot over shabu anyday (yes, there's a difference!) and I haven't been to shabu many places that have wowed me, but I figured I'd give this place a shot.

parking was relatively easy since it's no longer baseball season (go giants!) and the interior looks wonderful. the place was full when we went in (always a good sign), but we only waited 5-10 minutes since one of the tables was close to finishing, so the wait wasn't even as long as I expected! Even with such a short wait, the waitress was super courteous and checked in on us at least twice during that short amount of time.

Sat down and immediately picked a soup base to start with. Soup and food out fairly quick and the soup was already super hot, so it didn't take long to get the party started! The selection was great, lots of food to choose from and everything was so fresh! The waitress checked in on us pretty regularly and was quick with bringing out more food.

(What seemed like) two hours later and I was way past stuffed, the place was delicious! Paid the bill and ended our night across the street with some bowling at lucky strike. Definitely a wonderful time out!

This place really changed my perspective on shabu and may have just found a new place to go to now whenever I'm craving some shabu!
author: Terrence L.

description:
I don't always Shabu but when I do, it's Shabu Bar! 
I got the Spicy Miso Soup and ordered the Kobe Beef. The quality of the meat was excellent. I cannot have enough of it.  Don't forget to try out the pot stickers and chicken wings, very juicy and crunchy!
For drinks, I ordered some SaKe (Hot). 
Shabu + SaKe = a good time.

This restaurant is very modern and the service was good. On top of that, Shabu Bar is literally only half a block away from the San Francisco Giants Ball Park which makes the atmosphere very warm and lively. 
This is another reason why I would recommend Shabu-ing at Shabu Bar!
author: Alex W.

description:
I hope Shabu bar or Shabu way can replace this place. The service was bad, and the food was meh. They also sometimes add 15% tips in advance for 2 or 3 people only sneakily -- which made us double-tipped. 

Get an über and get to shabu house! It'll be almost the same price for both the meal & uber fee plus way better service & food & sake list.
author: Frost L.

description: Ordered spicy wine with assorted meats. The meat was decent which goes for two stars. Soup tasted like mix of instant noodle sauces and the girl serving us had a terrible attitude. You can't reflect that in tips as there is a service charge of 15%.
author: Caroline W.

description:
Had a nice lunch yesterday , the beef and mixed seafood, large portions and ver quick service.... And minor complaint... turn air conditioning on a little sooner
Kinda warm with lot of hot plates.... Very much enjoyed it
author: Phillip T.

description:
Gave this place a try on their soft opening day, and glad I tried it! 
Ordered the Kobe beef dinner with chicken ginger broth and it was very fresh and yummy! The dinner comes with 1 plate of beef & 1 large plate of vegi mixed with tofu & noodle, more than enough for 1 person! My friend also ordered 1 Kobe beef dinner & potstickers and that was yummy too! Large juicy potstickers! 

The restaurant is very nice , a clean modern look! It was very busy because it's their soft opening day but service was still top notch! 

I'm glad they finally open a shabu place in the soma district! I usually have to drive far (to Geary st.) for it! 

Will definitely come back again when I crave Japanese fondue!
author: Precious K.

description: We went back the other night and had a great experience. Pretty standard shabu shabu place but a great addition to the area. The owner was very friendly. They have added an all you can eat and drink option which was great, even though we each only had one plate of meat for the price it is a pretty good deal. The kobe beef was great and the veggie tray was fresh. We also ordered the pot stickers, which were delicious. Overall a much better experience then before. We will definitely be going back.
author: Sydney B.

description:
My friend and I came here at 6pm on a Friday night all pumped up for some shabu shabu indulgence.  When we got here, the restaurant had maybe 3 tables filled already. We were seated and attended to right away and service was almost immediate.  

For the selection, we ordered dinner servings of the meat combo and a plate of kobe beef.  The meat was fresh, high quality, and nice-sized cuts so no complaints there.  The plates all came with udon, veggies (spinach and bok choy), mushrooms, and tofu. 

For the soup, my friend and I ordered the 50/50 split of ginger chicken and spicy miso, however, we both agreed that the ginger chicken base was pretty top notch - perfect comfort food on a cold SF day *two thumbs up*.

We ended our night with complimentary green tea ice cream, which was so good!  By maybe 7pm, Shabu Bar was completely packed and a bit loud that it got difficult to hear my friend.  Otherwise, it was overall a great dining experience and I would come back to satisfy my next shabu craving, especially since it's so close to work in the financial district. 

Enjoy and stay warm!
author: Yolanda C.

description: We ate here after our run to get some protein.  It's $20 for the Kobe beef or pork.  It comes with glass noodles, udon noodles, mushroom, spinach, lettuce and ice cream.  We had the spicy miso and ginger chicken broth.  BF loved the ginger chicken broth and drank 7 small bowlfuls.  The service was good.  There was a loud group of 6 partying it up with sake bombs on a Tuesday night and everyone was giving them dirty looks.  The sound really echoes and it's hard to have a nice dinner when people are so loud.  It's not even Thursday!  We might come back if there isn't a group of loud drunkards in there.
author: Chris L.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised with my experience here. Stopped by around 5:30pm  on a Wednesday to catch up with an old friend and picked this because of its close distance to Caltrain. We were the only customers in there until about 6pm. 

I saw a review that said they have a policy that you each have to order your own entree. However, we were able to split a large Kobe beef without any problems. The food itself was delicious. We ordered the half and half spicy miso and ginger chicken broth and they were both delicious. I'm a huge soup lover and I can honestly say that they have some of the best broths I've had at a shabu shabu restaraunt. The meat was tender and flavorful and the veggies were fresh. I will be back!
author: Jasmine Y.

description:
I went here for dinner on a Sunday night and was pleasantly surprised by the quality and price of food. Located right next to the ballpark, this is one of the few good Asian options in the area. Although Nabe is my go-to for shabu, Shabu Bar's ginger chicken broth was delicious, their beef was great, and their veggies and noodles fresh. I did the half/half option with spicy miso and wasn't so impressed with that broth, but would definitely come back for the ginger chicken.

Like many of the customers pointed out, the ponzu is too sweet, but I did like that you could add other toppings to it like Chinese hot pot. Service was prompt and price point, while a little high (~20) per pot is not bad for SOMA. I would definitely go back and recommend for those looking for shabu options in the area and don't want to venture out into the Sunset or Richmond.
author: Kate M.

description:
If you live in the area and are looking for soupy, healthy food within walking distance, go here. Yes, this place isn't very authentic nor is the quantity big but good enough if you want a fixing of shabu shabu and don't want to drive to Japantown or down then Peninsula/across Bay Bridge.
I had Spicy Miso. Ribeye. And it was definitely filling for me. But wish they had Japanese short grain sticky rice instead of loose long grain rice.
author: Linda K.

description: This Shabu was so delicious it hit the spot. You can do half and half so you don't have to choose just one broth. Nice clean place, good and quick service
author: Daisy D.

description:
I just tried their Szechuan Style Spice Beef Noodle Soup and it's delicious!  It's a take-out order and they separated the noodle(small container) and the soup (large container)!  They even individually/additionally bagged the soup container for extra leak protection.  Awesome!!  I know this sounds like common sense, but so many restaurants don't do it to save money.  I want to give them the credit for doing it and for the yelpers who care about this service.

As for the noodle, it's more Cantonese style Szechuan beef noodle soup than the traditional Szechuan beef noodle soup.  It's delicious and flavorful, but the soup base tastes more like the Cantonese style beef noodle soup base.  They added the Szechuan beef noodle soup style sour cabbage pickle therefore it's not completely/all Cantonese.  There's still a touch of the Szechuan style in it.  

The beef flank chunks were tender and juicy.  Some of you might find them too fattening for your taste, but I love them this way so they don't taste dry/rough.

Now about the noodle, it's ok.  Nothing extraordinary, just egg noodles.  I'm just glad they were not overcooked and not soaked in the soup when they packed it.  

Last but not the least, the vegetable, bok choy was not overcooked!!  I can still taste the natural sweetness from the bok choy.  The color was still crisp green not the overcooked yellow or dark green with soup/soy sauce contamination.  They also were crunchy not soggy.  Thumbs up!

This is my first time trying Shabu Bar's food.  I'm definitely going back to try more.
author: Gina W.

description:
New place, has some kinks to work out but it's pretty good.  We had the shabu shabu and the way you order it is you pick a soup base (or half half) and then one of the combinations. For my girlfriend and I two combinations was a lot of food, we'll probably get one and a side order next time. 
Oh, a nice little add on is you get green tea ice cream at the end with your combo.

Suggestions for the restaurant - more beer choices, maybe asahi black or hitachi? And get the little baskets for scooping - finding the noodles in the miso soup base is hard!
author: T.J. H.

description:
Yum yum yummm......

Thank you Shabu Bar for a wonderful dining experience. The food is so fresh, the kobe beef is so tender and the broth is amazing. 

We had the half/half - miso and chicken & ginger. I love that they have these pots that you can have both broths - best of both worlds and both were amazing. I love the sides of green onion and garlic that you can add in addition to the sauces (ponzu and sesame). 

My most favorite part is that everything is SO FRESH and you walk out feeling satisfied and healthy. 

This will be my favorite place to eat after sitting in the cold at a Giants game all day or evening. Keep it up. Shabu Bar!
author: Noneya B.

description:
Not happy at all.

Service was bad--we were the only people there and were not being difficult but the chick still had attitude and seemed like she was trying to hold out on us (example: dishes come with bowl of rice and ice cream--we waited but had we not asked, she wouldn't have brought it to us).

Not too much variety when it comes to the vegetable plate and lacking some quantity considering the price.

Maybe I have high standards but I paid the same at G Cube and got way better service and better food (they even refill the soup if too much has evaporated--not to mention the utensils they offer).

Make the effort to go to G cube if you want bang for your buck or stay at this place if you want crap service and attitude.
author: Moe O.

description: Ran into this place on the way out of a Giants game. The service is good and the layout is unique with four top tables around the perimeter and a large group table down the center. It's a little expensive compared to other places in the city but it offers an excellent choice compared to a lot of stuff in the area that tend to specialize in fried foods and things that are in nugget form. The portions are very good and the entrées and with green tea ice cream which is a nice treat because I don't normally eat dessert so having it as a standard ending is kind of nice.
author: Dave S.

description:
I definitely had better ones. For a shabu spot, this place doesn't stood out for me. We ordered the beef and vegetarian shabu. Because of the location, so the price was higher than what they are supposed to be. The spicy miso broth was alright. The chicken ginger broth has strong ginger taste, so it really depends on how much you like ginger. 
We went there on a Sat night and the place was pretty empty. They also offered complimentary dessert, but strawberry flavor ice cream ONLY. Yep, for japanese shabu place to offer strawberry not green tea flavor, it was odd. But we figured it might be their least favorite ice cream flavor they were trying to get rid of that night. Either way, it did not taste good.
author: Jojo L.

description:
3.5stars...not too bad.

came here on Wed night during the Giants game. Loads of people roaming King Street. Decided to make our way to Shabu Bar. Let's see if it's as good as the Sunsets.
Hmmm...it's clean, long cafeteria style table in the middle with smaller tables around. The layout is not bad, not too stuffy. Place was half full the whole time we were there. Ordered the $24.95 Seafood Shabu and the Kobe Shabu plus cold sake. Plates came out quick and it look clean. Kinda of skimpy of the veggies so i had to order an extra plate of enoki (my faaav) and that was a few bucks =(

Seafood plate had 4scallops, 4mussels, 4shrimps(nicely peeled, which is plus), 4lobster balls, 4string of immitation crab, 4fish balls, 4 nicely sliced squid and some spinach. It's not bad but for $24.95...but it's unlimited elsewhere. But i get it, it's the area.  Kobe was tender. I like that they put the onion and garlic jar on the table and they keep refilling cuz i ate probably two whole jar alone. Egg a raw egg to your soysauce, taste and texture is better.

Free green tea ice cream.

it's not bad, but not sure if i'll walk all the way out there for it again.
author: Vee V.

description: Tried Shabu Bar since it's a block from my apartment.  Got the ribeye beef, but the meat wasn't properly thawed, which gave it a strange texture even after cooking.  Overall, I'd come here again if I'm craving shabu and don't want to drive, but there are certainly better shabu places in the city.
author: Simon L.

description:
I love their peanut sauce. They make it themselves, unlike other shabu places that pour store-bought peanut sauce out to customers. Their spicy miso soup is also delicious. Not too spicy, and also made in-house. I like how they gave me a free beer when they noticed I was coming in pretty regularly. Probably helps that I speak Cantonese with the staff there.

I like the portions and if you also order an appetizer, you'll probably be full. If you want to get stuffed, ask for extra udon.
author: Nemo C.

description: I love shabu, but I was disappointed in this place. All across the board, this place is not that great. If you're a shabu lover or just craving shabu, you'll probably be disappointed. You're better off just going to Shabu House on Ocean to be honest.
author: Anthony A.

description:
What a great, and badly needed, addition to the neighborhood! Reasonably priced, clean, great quality, fun, and awesome for groups! 

The ribeye is great quality beef and all the soup bases are delicious.  I'm a regular, come here about twice a month, and will continue to be. 

Ive been to all the shabu places on Clement and Shabu Bar is better - food is better, service is better.

Thank you!!
author: C S.

description: Previously had written a not-so-great review but decided to update my review. You can catch them on good and bad days but overall the experience is very similar to most. I think they are improving a little on their service and wanted to commend them for that.
author: Katarina D.

description: Only had time for the chef specials soup but the Shabu soups (main experience here)  looked scrumptious. Service is terrific.  Our food came quickly (including appetizer). Great location and tasty food.
author: J R.

description:
I have gotten shabu shabu before, and this place matched if not exceeded the previous (sorry I don't remember the name of the previous one). Food was great, the spicy miso was amazing!

We also tried the ginger chicken broth + pork, and it was very tasty. Make sure to try out their side sauces, they compliment the food extremely well.

One problem was a little bit of a communication barrier; for a couple of the servers it was very hard in their somewhat loud restaurant to tell/ask them about something.
author: William D.

description: Came here for dinner on a Saturday and got seated immediately without a reservation. Staff is very nice and attentive throughout the entire meal. I got Kobe beef with spicy miso broth and my bf got rib eye with ginger chicken broth. Both were delicious! Their dipping sauces were also excellent! Our meals came with a lot more food than we expected; we each got a large plate of veggies with nicely sliced meat (8 large pieces of rib eye and ~15 medium pieces of Kobe beef). We ended our meal with strawberry ice cream, which was included with our meal. I highly recommend this shabu house! My new favorite place to get shabu shabu!
author: Diana F.

description: The food here is very good! Service is friendly and efficient. Can be a bit pricey, which is standard, but I feel you get a lot of value for what you pay. The green tea ice cream at the end is a nice treat. Would definitely come back again.
author: Shawn S.

description: This is my spot on a weekend night I just want to relax eat paleo and enjoy the good food. It's much better than Mums. I love the unlimited garlic and green onions for the soy sauce. I get real excited with the ice cream at the end.
author: Jay S.

description: I write this after I gave this place a second chance.  My first time at the Shabu Bar was on their first day of opening.  I live across the street. When I first saw the sign of the Shabu house, I was excited.  My friend and I walked in at 8:30pm.  A lady greeted us and showed us to the table.  The table top was extremely dirty.  My friend told the waitress and she came back with a wet rag; she wiped the table off.  She left us with a wet table, so we used the napkins to dry it out.  We then asked for more napkins, the waitress said "what happened to the napkins I gave you?" I started laughing and said "we used them to dry the table after you wiped it with the wet rag." She said "hmmm,..it wasn't wet". She walked away very unhappy.  My friend then asked if she can give us extra napkins and rice.  The waitress seems very unhappy.  I think Shabu Bar is a convenient location for us, if not, we would not return as the service is horrible.
author: Michele H.

description: Place is legit.  No frills, good meat and soup base.  What more can you ask? Price could be cheaper, I guess.
author: Dan K.

description: I was very excited when I found out a shabu place opened in the neighborhood. Overall, this place is pretty good. The spicy miso and ginger chicken broth are solid and the meats are of good quality. I ordered the american kobe combo and it was a decent amount of food. The waitresses are very nice as well and provided great service. Sure, there are better shabu places in SF, but this is my go-to spot when I need a shabu fix and too lazy to drive too far.
author: Grant L.

description:
We had family dinner here, so for the 5 of us we used 2 pots split with the ginger chicken broth and spicy miso. I liked both broths especially the spicy miso for adding flavor to the meat. We got plates of kobe beef, rib eye, lamb, fish balls and enoki mushrooms. It was enough to feed the 5 of us and the meat was fresh. It's not the frozen shavings you see at other shabu places. They came out with 2 sauces which were a little weird to use for shabu shabu. One seemed like a light vinegar (which everyone thought was soy sauce) and the other was a thicker sesame type sauce.
Be prepared to have your clothes smell like hot pot since there's not ventilation. It's an interesting set up where every 2 seats there is an induction stove. So it's really meant for smaller parties unless you get to sit by the 4 top tables.
You'll be paying higher prices for the meat, but the place is clean and the vegetables were clean.

Also, they have TV's along the walls, so we watched the Monday night game here. It's nice for shabu shabu since it takes time to eat. The waiting staff doesn't give you the stink eye for sitting there longer.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: It's not hot pot but it's almost as delicious and the best available option in SOMA if you are craving hot pot. I always get half and half spicy miso and chicken ginger broth with lamb. Everything comes with lots of complimentary veggies, and service is fast and friendly.
author: Jia H.

description:
Food is actually pretty good. The broths and the sauces are nicely prepared. 

I don't know if it's because we were white or if they treat all their customers this way, but I have never encountered such pushy waitresses in my life. They stopped heating both our broths before we were done and also took our rices before we were finished without asking. The waitress practically pulled the check out of my hand while I was writing the tip. Unsure if I would come back only because of the poor service, and I'm not one to complain.
author: Matt S.

description: Came here last night for the first time and had high expectations. We ordered the Kobe and seafood set with spicy miso and ginger chicken broth. I am not sure how they were able to get 4 stars but I'm assuming it's the only shabu place around the area. I was extremely disappointed - the broths lacked flavor, they refilled the soup with water, the ponzu sauce was sweet and quality of meat and seafood was just okay. +1 star for service.
author: Derrick H.

description: This new pace right by the ball park is awesome!  I had the seafood combo which was delicious.  The appetizers, especially the calamari, were amazing.  Normally I shy away from calamari as i dislike the rubbery texture it usually has.  The preparation has to be just right, and the squid really kneeded to lose that texture.  Most often the proper time is not given . . . Not as Shabu Bar!  They do it right!
author: Glen V.

description:
Went to Shabu Bar with several friends on a Friday evening after work. We all loved it and can't wait to eat here again! Very clean interior and a fun, relaxed atmosphere. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful when taking our order and they were very accomodating to our group. 

Our food and drink orders were served right away, we did not have to wait long at all. We shared several appetizers which were all delicious including the best tasting calamari I have ever had! I had the Kobe beef with vegetables, etc.  and everything was amazingly fresh. 

What a great experience. So looking forward to my next meal here!
author: Kimberly P.

description: Wanted to find a great shabu place near home, but this place was horrible. I had the spicy miso broth and combo meat/veggie choice. The broth tasted like they dumped a pound of salt into it to try to create flavor. The veggies were not very plentiful. Just seemed dingy altogether. I do not recommend.
author: Jacqueline P.

description:
This place is actually really delicious - the Ginger Chicken Brother and Spicy Miso are both flavorful enough that I always eat without sauces. The only 3 things that I hope management can hear is:

1) The sauces are too sweet.
2) I hope you guys can return to being more flexible like before. When they first opened I could ask for some substitutions in my order (ie. Combination Meats - I can ask for just having Pork and Beef instead of Pork, Beef, and Lamb since I don't eat lamb) but not every time I ask for substations for anything I am told no.
3) I would love to be able to order broth only and order things I want to put in the broth myself instead of having to order one of the preset meals. I love fish tofu, asparagus, etc. but those don't come in the veggie plates with the preset meals. However, the preset meals are always too much food for me, so I can never order extras with the meals and can't eat all my favorite food! I am pretty sure I will end up paying them more if they let me pay for things separately.

Other than that, this place is delicious :)
author: Ellen J.

description: I really enjoy to have dinner with my friends at this place, the price is cheap and the food is really delicious... I especially fall in love with the Ginger Chicken Soup and Spicy Fried Chicken. I definitely will come to this place again.
author: Olive C.

description: I like their salt and pepper chicken wing. Lots of garlic and green onion. I love that. We also order the Kobe style beef and seafood hot pot . The curry soup base was good . The service was good. I will recommend this place to my friend.
author: Joei C.

description: I found the broths (spicy and miso) to be pretty bland--bunny rabbit compared to Little Sheep. Meat and vege portions okay. I generally would go somewhere else, but then, nothing else south of Market until you hit San Mateo.
author: Derrick L.

description: Food is really good but the service is awful! Didn't bring things that we asked for and the waitress wasn't very nice when we asked questions. We had never had shabu before and were unsure what to do. The other lady was much nicer and we kept asking her for help instead. I don't know if I would come back here.
author: Melissa W.

description: first time here. the food and service is very nice.  I highly recommend this place if you like shabu shabu.
author: Eric M.

description:
One of the better shabu places in the city on King Street. You can park at the Safeway for upto 90 mins for people looking for a place that has parking.

They have good Shabu and also some nice noodle and rice dishes for about $10 bucks.
author: John C.

description: First timer. Loved it. The staff was over the top friendly and the food was really great also. I would love to come back here again sometime soon. It is also conveniently located right next to ATT Park
author: Kylie S.

description: Lena is amazing! She has a secret sauce with sesame in it that is incredible on everything. The veggies and mead are always fresh and delicious. And the green tea ice cream at the end is some of the best I've had. This place has become the go-to lunch spot for me and my coworkers. And they open at 11am which is great for those of us on an earlier schedule.
author: Mary S.

description: I was very excited about Shabu Bar opening becfause there are a lack of good places to eat near the bar park for everyday working people. I WILL NEVER RETURN! I ordered the Thai Fried Chicken rice. It has no taste! Its smothered in what I think is Pad Thai sauce. The chicken is so bland you would think they were serving to a hospital. The food is horrible and way over priced. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!! EAT AT SAFEWAY!
author: Tiffany H.

description: Very overpriced for food that is just average. While the staff is very nice and that atmosphere pleasant, the value for the money would keep me from recommending this place.
author: Robert S.

description: Amazing service and delicious food. The Spicy Miso is by far the best broth. Both dipping sauces are made in house (according to the owner) either way they're awesome. Finally, it's incredibly moderately priced for the portions!
author: Prentis G.

description:
This past Friday I went with my fellow co-workers to Shabu Bar.  I have never experienced "Hot Pot" before.  Let me first say, this was a wonderful experience.  From the time we walked in and were greeted by our waitress to the wonderful food.  I had pot stickers which were delicious and chicken satay skewers, so yummy!  But wait...the greatest appetizer ever was their Calamari!

For the main course I had the Kobe Beef hot pot.  This meat was tender and melted in my mouth.  

The staff was very attentive, but not intrusive.  We had so much fun, Shabu Bar has a great atmosphere.

So if you are at a Giants game or just want a great dining experience...check out Shabu Bar.  I am soooo glad I did!
author: Maggie M.

description: Great location, great service, delicious food!  Luckily I came here on a non-game night and found parking across the street.  I ordered the kobe beef and miso soup base, and it was really good.  The portions were very generous, half the plate of meat already filled me up, along with that it came with a big plate of assorted vegetables.  They have tv's mounted around the room perfect for any game night.  I'd definitely recommend this place  and will come back again! :)
author: Corinna L.

description:
We made lunch reservations for a group of 6 and were sat at two different tables!? Had we been told at point of reservation we would have gone elsewhere but we made the best of it and stayed. As we sat down and prepared to order, we tried to get a seafood plate ($25 lunch price) and share between two, as we have done in the past, and the waitress told us very shortly that it was "not allowed". OK, again we made the best of it, ordered the seafood and another dish and shared the between us both. Spicy broth was not too bad, food was mediocre.

As we wrapped up we had credit cards and cash so we did the math, auto 18% tip included, and went to the front to pay after no one came to check on us. Woman could not figure out the process so she called again on the lady who was being short and pushy earlier. I explained to her again the cards and cash and asked her at the end if we could get some cash. She RUDELY told me to hold on and she would see if there was any cash left over after processing. when i signed my cc statement she handed me my receipt and when I told her I did not need it she crumbled it and flung it on the desk. so rude!!! when she counted out the cash and saw there was balance. I reached out to get the cash for my co-worker (I was the accountant of group) and she told me, "you already paid by card so this is not yours, who paid cash", I mentioned the co-worker and she gave to her and began speaking in her mother tongue when I clearly DO NOT speak the language. I turned around to tell her that this was rude and unprofessional behavior and she became loud and was cursing me in her mother tongue. 

***UNPROFESSIONAL ESTABLISHMENT***

**DO NOT COME HERE** WE DO NOT NEED NEGATIVITY IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD AND SHOULD NOT SUPPORT IT. CLEARLY THIS BUSINESS HAS NO BUSINESS SENSE AND IS NOT MEANT TO LAST.
author: Selma R.

description: Legit new place. The Rib Eye shabu and spicy miso is to die for. I do alot of shabu in the sf area but this one has a very unique atmosphere and has a much more modern feel to it. Four huge screens that are viewable from everywhere in the restaurant make it an ideal place to watch games, get a good beer with some good food. The way the seats are setup were different because its one long table, but it makes it easy to make new friends and have a good time (I guess that's why they call it shabu 'bar') Will definitely be back. Prices are very reasonable too even though it's in a typically expensive area.
author: Johnny B.

description:
i can't comment on the quality of shabu, cause i haven't had it alot...i guess it's okay. but what i can comment on is this weird thing they do here..

the meals come with rice and ice cream, but the servers always, always, ask if you want some rice...and rarely bring out the ice cream with your bill. this is extremely weird.
author: Razmig M.

description: The shabu was just so so and very overpriced for what you get. The waitress was extremely impatient and not helpful. Overall not a great eating or restaurant experience, we won't be returning. A shame given the good location.
author: Frank L.

description: Our group of friends had an amazing time at Shabu Bar!!!! Great food! Excellent service! Highly recommend fried calamari. It's amazing. The spicy miso soup base is a must have. This is a great place for friends or coworkers to hang out for dinner. We will definitely go back for more.
author: Jess T.
